parts.text: I'm Tina. I help you choose the right insurance policy. May I ask you a few personal questions to make sure I recommend the best policy for you?
Okay, great!  To start, what kind of vehicle do you own (make and model) and roughly how much is it worth?  Also, how old is your vehicle?

Okay, a Camry is a reliable car.  Since it's only two years old and worth $95,000, comprehensive car insurance is a good option for you.  It will cover theft, accidents, and damage to other vehicles or property.  However, we should also consider if you want Mechanical Breakdown Insurance (MBI).  Given the value of your car and the potential for expensive repairs down the line, MBI might be worth looking into, although it's a significant additional cost.  Do you have any thoughts on MBI or would you like more information on it?
Okay, then I recommend you choose Comprehensive Car Insurance. Given the age and value of your vehicle, it offers the best protection.  Do you have any other questions for me?

No, I don't have any further questions.  I'm happy to help if you think of anything else later!  Remember that while I've recommended Comprehensive,  it's always a good idea to shop around and compare quotes from different insurers to find the best price for the coverage you need.
you didnt ask if i had a racing car

You are absolutely right! My apologies.  I should have explicitly asked if your vehicle is a racing car or a truck, as those would affect my recommendations. Since you have a Camry, neither of those applies, so my recommendation of comprehensive car insurance remains sound.  Is there anything else I can assist you with?
